metadata.description:
In 2007 and 2008, Landsat data set 49 scenes, covering the entire black river basin.
The acquisition time is:2007-08-12, 2007-09-23, 2008-01-05, 2008-02-06, 2008-03-17, 2008-03-25, 2008-05-10, 2008-05-19, 2008-05-28, 2008-06-04, 2008-07-07, 2008-07-15, 2008-07-22, 2008-07-23, 2008-08-16, 2008-08-30,2008-09-08, 2008-09-15, 2008-09-17, 2008-10-01, 2008-10-10, 2008-10-19, 2008-10-26, 2008-11-02, 2008-11-04, 2008-11-18, 2008-11-20, 2008-11-27, 2008-12-06, 2008-12-13, 2008-12-14.
The product is class L1 and has been geometrically corrected.It includes 4 scenes of TM image and 45 scenes of ETM+ image.
The Landsat satellite remote sensing data set of heihe integrated remote sensing joint experiment was obtained through free download.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of how Landsat remote sensing data was utilized to cover a specific river basin over multiple time periods, and what data processing techniques might have been employed to ensure accuracy?
Example.Answer: An example of utilizing Landsat remote sensing data to cover a specific river basin is the dataset covering the entire Heihe River Basin. It includes 49 scenes from 2007 to 2008, with data acquisition on specific dates such as 2007-08-12, 2008-01-05, and others. The data is at L1 level, indicating that it has undergone geometric correction, ensuring accuracy. This dataset includes 4 TM images and 45 ETM+ images, and it is available for free download.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics and processing levels of Landsat datasets used in remote sensing experiments?
Feature Specification.Answer: Level 1 geometric correction, 49 scenes, Heihe River Basin, 4 scenes from TM sensor, 45 scenes from ETM+ sensor

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the main objectives of collecting and processing Landsat remote sensing data for the Heihe River Basin from 2007 to 2008?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The main objectives include providing comprehensive coverage of the entire Heihe River Basin to aid in geographical and environmental studies. The dataset, processed to L1 level with geometric correction, aims to ensure accurate and reliable data for analysis. By offering free access to the data, the goal is to facilitate research and understanding of the region's dynamics using both TM and ETM+ imagery.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are involved in acquiring and preparing Landsat remote sensing data to cover an entire river basin like Heihe for a comprehensive remote sensing joint experiment?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedures involve acquiring Landsat data from specific dates between 2007 and 2008, ensuring the dataset covers the entire Heihe river basin with 49 scenes. The data, consisting of TM and ETM+ images, undergoes geometric correction to achieve Level 1 product quality. This corrected dataset is then made available for free download for further analysis.
